description.narrative: Miscellaneous services, supplies, Home Leave and other general travel, overtime and security guards.,which contributes to Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2019, the most vulnerable boys, girls and families will have access to appropriate water and sanitation facilities and live in open defecation free communities.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 2707 Luanda Republic of Angola

sector.narrative: WASH - risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Miscellaneous services, supplies, Home Leave and other general travel, overtime and security guards.

description.narrative:
Emergency safe water provided to 121,496 people and basic sanitation provided to 67,498 vulnerable people affected by the protracted drought in the southern provinces of Bie, Huila and Cunene, and improved hygiene practices promoted among 134,994 people.
Provided access to safe water (including through equipped boreholes and water supply network systems) to 20,335 people from DRC living in Lovua refugee settlement in the province of Lunda Norte (northern Angola), together with improved access to basic emergency sanitary facilities and hygiene promotion practices. | Status:Met | As-of Date:13/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of people with access to safe water, sanitation and hygiene promotion (as per agreed standards) in emergency situations
Child-sensitive national risk management plans addressing risks related to WASH in emergencies are in place

actual.value: 2019:UNICEF is applying but still a work in progress with government.
